meanings.definition: The terminal part of the human arm located below the forearm, used for grasping and holding.
meanings.sent1: She used her hand to pick up the book.
meanings.sent2: He shook my hand when we met.
meanings.sent3: The hand waved at the passing cars.
meanings.sent4: The hand of friendship was extended to the new student.
meanings.sent5: The baby's tiny hand wrapped around her finger.

meanings.definition: A pointer or indicator on a clock or watch indicating the time.
meanings.sent1: The small hand pointed to the number six.
meanings.sent2: The hour hand shows the current time.
meanings.sent3: The hand on the clock seemed to be in a hurry.
meanings.sent4: Time slipped through the hands like sand.
meanings.sent5: The hand moved steadily towards midnight.

meanings.definition: A round of applause or approval.
meanings.sent1: The audience gave a loud hand after the performance.
meanings.sent2: The hand echoed through the auditorium.
meanings.sent3: The hand was music to the performer's ears.
meanings.sent4: The hand was like a thunderous storm of appreciation.
meanings.sent5: The hand filled the room with joy and gratitude.

meanings.sent1: Her hand was elegant and neat on the paper.
meanings.sent2: The doctor's hand was difficult to read.
meanings.sent3: His hand seemed to have a mind of its own on the page.
meanings.sent4: The hand danced across the letter with grace.
meanings.sent5: The hand told a story through its strokes.

meanings.sent1: The farmhand worked hard in the fields.
meanings.sent2: The construction hand lifted heavy materials.
meanings.sent3: The hand toiled under the scorching sun.
meanings.sent4: The hand built the foundation of the house.
meanings.sent5: The hand's sweat showed the effort put into the work.
